monogr.title: Archæologiæ Atticæ libri tres. = Three bookes of the Attick antiquities : Containing the description of the citties glory, government, division of the people, and townes within the Athenian territories, their religion, superstition, sacrifices, account of their yeare, as also a full relation of their iudicatories. By Francis Rous scholler of Merton Colledge in Oxon
monogr.author: Rous, Francis

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: Errata & inserenda.
div.p:
PAge 5. line 5. read mysteries. p. 6. in Argum. read Circuitus. p. 11. in Marg. for or r. nor. p. 13. in Marg. k. l. m. p. 16. l. 24. r. abject. p. 18. in Marg. r. in Solone. p. 22. l. 12. put the parenthesis after Curialis l. 23. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . p. 23. l. 26. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . p. 28. r. cap. 7. l. 17. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . p. 29. l. 18. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 p. 32. l. 1. after, 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 put the parenthesis. p. 34. in marg. r. in the hist. p. 39. l. 24. r. from. p. 40. l. 25. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 l 32▪ 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . p. 41. l. • . r. imminent. in marg▪ r. Frag. p. 46 l. 34. r. Polycleti. p 47. l. 15. r. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 . p. • 5. l. 14. r. crier. l. 20. r. Muneris. l. 29. read thus 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 the Hebrew which availes as much as to offer, and Missath an offering Deu. 16. 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
missath nidhbath a free offering, taken it seemes of prayer and praise. Weichelius Est autem missa vocula Hebraica, quod nos Latine oblationem aut munus vocamus, quod sponte propriis manibus defertur at{que} expenditur in veros pietatis usus. p. 8. in Arg. r. Satyrica fabula. p. 9 • . l. 2. after 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , which were noted by letters. Other faults your candid judgements may amend.
